Field Description:
Unique Data Source Identifier assigned by Pfizer. Unique across all datasets for all indications/disease/therapeutic areas.
(was "REFID")
Sample Data:
[Indication-Disease-Prefix]-sequential integer
301-1
301-4
302-5

Field Description: Authors in semicolon separated list
Sample Data:
LI: Andrei, A. ; Smith, C
IR: Elan Pharmaceutical Research Corporation

Authors are recorded as 
LASTNAME<SPACE CHARACTER>FIRSTINITIAL; LASTNAME<SPACE CHARACTER>FIRSTINITIAL; etc

Field Description: Title of the clinical trial paper. Not to be confused with the journal name. It can be a long title with punctuations.
Sample Data: LI: Recent data on anti-inflammatory ,or analgesic treatment

Field Description: Journal Name
Sample Data: ARCH.MED.INTERNA

Field Description: 4 digit numeric Year value of the publication year
Journal Volume
Journal Issue Number, not to be confused with the Publication Volume
Hyphen delimited pages of the paper in the journal
Sample Data:
Page Ranges are separated by a tilde "~" character:
245~256

Field Description: Abstract of the clinical trial
Sample Data:
LI: Lonarid, an association of analgesic and antipyrethic drugs, was administered…
IR: Background: The sponsor has submitted two randomized, double-blind, multicenter, placebo controlled trials…

Quotation Marks (Single and Double) and Commas must be excluded from the abstract. While this implies an edit to most abstract texts, it's required for this format.

Field Description: Name that the study is represented in the clinical community or literature. Often some letters in all caps and may include numbers. Ex: IMPROVE, ESTEEM1
Sample Data:
”IMPROVE”
"ESTEEM1" - aprimilast study for psoriasis NCT: NCT01194219

Field Description: NCT ID, if present

Valid Entries:
AD
T2D
Field Description: Indication description which can include comorbidity as a semi colon separated list

Valid Entries:
Parallel
Crossover
Enrichment
LTE
OLE
Single arm
Field Description: Parallel, Crossover, Enrichment, LTE = Long Term Extension, OLE = Open Label Extension, Single Arm
Sample Data:
Parallel
crossover
LTE = Long Term Extension
OLE = Open Label Extension

Valid Entries:
US
UK
FR
DE
etc

If reported as GLOBAL in the data source, then report as GLOBAL, otherwise report individual two letter codes as indicated in the ISO website.


If not reported or missing, then do not record a value, i.e. leave the field as empty.
Field Description: Geographical location of the study as two letter countries separated by semicolon (e.g. UK;BE;...), or global, if it was specifically reported as global. If not reported or missing, then do not record a value
Sample Data:
US = United States
UK = United Kingdom
FR = France
GLOBAL = global
If not reported or missing, then do not record a value, i.e. leave the field as empty.

Valid Entries:
Phase 1
Phase 2
Phase 3
Phase 4
Field Description: Phase 1 - early development, typically PRE-POC but could be "Clinical Pharmacology" study type, i.e. executed in late phase development to support labelling, i..e. DDI, special populations, etc. Phase 2. Phase 3. Phase 4 - post approval/post marketing
Sample Data:
Phase 1
Phase 2
Phase 3
Phase 4

Field Description: Treatment ARM identifier: 1, 2, 3, 4, etc

Valid Entries:
Double-Blind
Single-Blind
Open-Label
Sponsor Open
Field Description: Double-Blind, Single-Blind, Open-Label, Sponsor Open=Investigator/Patient Blind
Sample Data: double-blind, single-blind, placebo-controlled

Valid Entries:
TRUE
FALSE
(or EMPTY of not known or missing, i.e. no entry made)
Field Description: Flag to indication whether subjects were randomized to treatment or not within the selected study arm. TRUE or FALSE or empty if not known or missing.
Sample Data:
TRUE
FALSE
If not reported or missing, then do not record a value, i.e. leave the field as empty.

Field Description: Actual treatment name, typically reporting the generic drug name. Use United state adopted name (USAN). Multiple entries are entered delimited in order by semi-colons
Sample Data:
arm.trt1;arm.trt2;arm.trt3  # no missing entries
;arm.trt2;arm.trt3                # missing entry # 1
arm.trt1;;arm.trt3                  # missing entry # 2
arm.trt1;arm.trt2;                  # missing entry # 3

Field Description: Multiple entries are entered delimited in order by semi-colons
Sample Data:
"Non-pharmacologic" for non drug therapies
ARM.TRTCLASS should be the CLASS identified through WHODrug or recorded by Clinical Disease Expert
Must be approved by Pfizer
arm.trtclass1;arm.trtclass2;arm.trtclass3  # no missing entries
;arm.trtclass2;arm.trtclass3                # missing entry # 1
arm.trtclass1;;arm.trtclass3                  # missing entry # 2
arm.trtclass1;arm.trtclass2;                  # missing entry # 3
arm.trtclass1;;                  # missing entry # 2 and 3 - only occurs if the remaining data for ARM.TRT etc is available

Field Description: Dose reported for a particular study arm. Could be expressed as an Average Daily Dose or even an average Dose computed during the course of a titration. Multiple entries are entered delimited in order by semi-colons
Sample Data:
Dose=average amount of dose, else Record as BLANK/EMPTY in an Excel File if value is not reported or is missing.
arm.dose1;arm.dose2;arm.dose3  # no missing entries
;arm.dose2;arm.dose3                # missing entry # 1
arm.dose1;;arm.dose3                  # missing entry # 2
arm.dose1;arm.dose2;                  # missing entry # 3

Valid Entries:
MG
GM
KG
UG
PG
LB
OZ
ML
UG/KG
NG
MG/K
MG/KG
MG/KG/DAY
MG/L
MG/DAY
MCG/HR
OTHER
Field Description: Dose Units units reported for a particular study arm. Multiple entries are entered delimited in order by semi-colons
Sample Data:
PDS Standards tables
MG = milligrams
GM = grams
KG = kilograms
UG = micrograms
PG = picograms
LB = pounds
OZ = Ounces
ML = milliliters
UG/KG = micrograms/kilogram
NG = nanograms
MG/KG=milligrams/kilogram
MG/KG/DAY = milligrams/kilogram/day
MG/L = milligrams/liter
MG/DAY = milligrams/day
MCG/HR =  microgram/hour
OTHER = OTHER

arm.doseu1;arm.doseu2;arm.doseu3  # no missing entries
;arm.doseu2;arm.doseu3                # missing entry # 1
arm.doseu1;;arm.doseu3                  # missing entry # 2
arm.doseu1;arm.doseu2;

Valid Entries:
ORAL
IV BOLUS
IV INFUSION
SUBCUTANEOUS INJECTION
DERMAL
VAGINAL
RECTAL
NASAL
EYE
Ocular
Topical
Ocular IVT
If not reported or missing, then do not record a value, i.e. leave the field as empty.
Field Description: Multiple entries are entered delimited in order by semi-colons
Sample Data:
ORAL
IV BOLUS
IV INFUSION
SUBCUTANEOUS INJECTION
DERMAL
VAGINAL
RECTAL
NASAL
EYE
Ocular
Topical
Ocular IVT
If not reported or missing, then do not record a value, i.e. leave the field as empty.

arm.route1;arm.route2;arm.route3  # no missing entries
;arm.route2;arm.route3                # missing entry # 1
arm.route1;;arm.route3                  # missing entry # 2
arm.route1;arm.route2;                  # missing entry # 3

Valid Entries:
QD
QW
QAM
QPM
BID
TID
QID
TIW
Q3H
Q4H
Q36H
Q48H
Q72H
If not reported or missing, then do not record a value, i.e. leave the field as empty.
Field Description: Dose regimen or frequency. Multiple entries are entered delimited in order by semi-colons
Sample Data:
QD= once a day
QW = once a week
QAM = once daily in the morning
QPM = once daily in the afternoon
BID= twice a day
TID= three times a day
QID = four times a day
TIW = three times a week
Q3H = every three hours
Q4H =  every four hours
Q36H =  every 36 hours
Q48H = every 48 hours
Q72H = every 72 hours
If not reported or missing, then do not record a value, i.e. leave the field as empty.

arm.regimen1;arm.regimen2;arm.regimen3  # no missing entries
;arm.regimen2;arm.regimen3                # missing entry # 1
arm.regimen1;;arm.regimen3                  # missing entry # 2
arm.regimen1;arm.regimen2;                  # missing entry # 3

Valid Entries:
CAP
TAB
SUS
SOL
SUP
ELI
SYR
OIN
CON
INH-AER
TAB-CR
CAP-CR
FCIR
(or EMPTY of not known or missing, i.e. no entry made)
Field Description: Dosage form for a particular study arm. Multiple entries are entered delimited in order by semi-colons. e.g. CAP, TAB, SUS, SOL, FCIR, etc. (or empty if not known or missing)
Sample Data:
CAP= Capsule
TAB = Tablet
SUS = Suspension
SOL = solution
SUP = suppository
ELI = elixir
SYR = syrup
OIN = ointment
CON = concentrate
INH-AER = aerosol inhalant
TAB-CR = controlled release tablet
CAP-CR = controlled release capsule
FCIR = film coated immediate release

arm.formulation1;arm.formulation2;arm.formulation3  # no missing entries
;arm.formulation2;arm.formulation3                # missing entry # 1
arm.formulation1;;arm.formulation3                  # missing entry # 2
arm.formulation1;arm.formulation2;                  # missing entry # 3

Field Description: Total number of subjects enrolled in the entire study and intended to be treated. Not tied to a specific treatment nor study arm.
Sample Data:
Total number of subjects in the study, Record as BLANK/EMPTY in an Excel File if value is not reported or is missing.

N.STUDY 202
N.STRATA 104
N.ARM 26
N.ARM.IMPUTE  4
N.ARM.EVENT 2
ARM.IMPUTE OC

Field Label: Number of subjects in treatment arm
Sample Data: Total number of subjects for each treatment

Field Description: Within a specific reported statistical analysis method and population
Sample Data: This is the number of observed cases, Record as BLANK/EMPTY in an Excel File if value is not reported or is missing.

Field Label: Number of unique subjects reporting an event by treatment arm

Valid Entries:
ITT
mITT
FAS
PP
SA
CO
Field Description: ITT - Intention to Treat, mITT - modified ITT, FAS - full analysis set, PP - per protocol, SA - safety anlaysis population, CO - completers only

Field Description: Details the stats analysis method. e.g. Least Square Means, Kaplan Meier

Field Label: Imputation method of values in observation
Valid Entries:
NRI
LOCF
BOCF
OC
MMRM
(additional terms to be vetted by Pfizer as encountered by data curation team)
Field Description: Methdology used in the statistical analysis to impute missing data. e.g. NRI - Non-responders imputation, LOCF - last observed carried forward, BOCF - Baseline Observation Carried Forward, OC - Observed cases (i.e. implicitly no imputation), MMRM - mixed-model repeated measures, (Blank/Missing/Empty if no imputation reported)

Field Label: Nominal Time Value for the ARM Endpoint
Field Description: For longitudinal or time based measurements or endpoints, TIME1 permits recording replicates within a period.
Sample Data:
Three time units (i.e. weeks) prior to start of first dose = -3
Two time units  prior to start of second dose= -2
One time unit prior to start of first dose= -1
Baseline time = 0
First time unit of the first dose=1  
Second time unit after the first dose =2
3rd time unit=3
4th time unit=4
5th time unit=5
etc…
Record as BLANK/EMPTY in an Excel File if value is not reported or is missing.

Valid Entries:
DAY = days
WK = weeks
MTH = months
YR = years
HR = hours
MIN = minutes
SEC = seconds
MSEC = milliseconds
(or EMPTY of not known or missing, i.e. no entry made)
Field Description: Units of Time for a particular study arm

Endpoint Name/Term for Absolute Measurement

When collecting Hazard Ratios or Odds Ratios record as PFS-HR (Progression Free Survival) or OS-HR (Overall Survival) where HR stands for "Hazard Ratio" or "-OR" for Odds Ratio.

Harvard - Pfizer to suply based on selected abstracts
Sample Data:
HbA1c
EASI
EASI 75
EASI 90

Mean
Median
LSMean

Pooled.LSMean

Sample Data: Mean, median, events no. at study entry,

Field Description: Baseline value of the endpoint at the beginning of treatment period for a study arm, if available
Sample Data:
baseline value prior to the start of treatment
Record as BLANK/EMPTY in an Excel File if value is not reported or is missing.

Field Description: Units of the baseline response
Standard deviation, standard error, of the baseline value
Sample Data:
Variance of the outcome
If not reported or missing, then do not record a value, i.e. leave the field as empty.

Valid Entries:
SD
SE
80% CI
90% CI
95% CI
SEbar
